class.name: QSoftBodyNode
class.description: QSoftBodyNode is a body type that defines deformable, soft objects in the physics world. Mass-spring model is used for simulation dynamics in soft bodies. In the mass-spring model, there are particles with mass that can move individually and interact with the physics world, and these particles can be connected to each other with spring constraints. Additionally, with some user-configurable options specific to the simulation, particles can be subjected to constraints obtained from some calculations. For example, you can add a constraint that ensures particles remain faithful to their initially defined local positions using the "shape matching" option. You can apply a constraint that gives the feeling that the polygon are filled with gas and maintains their area using the "area preserving" option. You can use options that allow particles to collide with each other with a specific radius, and create objects called PBD (Position Based Dynamics). QSoftBody objects inherently require a more flexible configuration than other body types and contain many options.

method.name: get_shape_matching_fixed_position
method.description: Returns the position of the target shape during shape matching if the fixed transform feature is active.

method.name: get_shape_matching_fixed_rotation
method.description: Returns the rotation of the target shape during shape matching if the fixed transform feature is active.

method.name: get_target_preservation_area
method.description: Returns the total target area to apply area preserving if the area preserving is enabled.

method.name: set_area_preserving_enabled
method.description: Sets whether the area preserving option is enabled of the body. If the area preserving option is enabled, the total area of the polygon are calculated at each physics step, and forces are applied to the particles that define the boundaries of the polygon to achieve a total area that can be determined by the user. If the user does not specify, when this option is enabled, the target area is calculated based on the original positions of the polygon particles, in other words, the total area of undeformed polygons are set as the target area. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_area_preserving_rate
method.description: Sets the rate to apply area preserving to the body if the area preserving is enabled. Determines the rate of the target area to apply preserve constraints. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_area_preserving_rigidity
method.description: Sets the rigidity to apply area preserving to the body if the area preserving is enabled. Determines the hardness of the restrictions to be applied to particles for the application of the target area. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_particle_spesific_mass
method.description: Sets the particle-specific mass value of the body. This value is used if the particle-specific mass option is enabled. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_particle_spesific_mass_enabled
method.description: Sets whether the particle-spesific mass option is enabled for the body. If this option is set to true, particles will continue to move with the mass defined for the body, but a specific mass value provided by you will be used for collision and constraint calculations. In most case, you don't want the mass value defined for the entire soft body object to be used for individual particle collision and constraint responses. Instead, you can define a specific particle mass value by dividing the mass value of the body by the number of particles, for example. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_passivation_of_internal_springs_enabled
method.description: Sets whether to passivate the internal spring connections of the soft body. If this option is enabled, the internal springs are more passive in the simulation, which can be useful for soft bodies where the internal springs and particle connections only provide UV and other data based on the movement of the soft body. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_rigidity
method.description: Sets the rigidity of the body. It determines the rigidity of the spring joints of the body. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_self_collision_enabled
method.description: Sets whether self particle collisions are enabled for the body. If set to true, all mesh parts within the body will collide with each other. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_self_collisions_specified_radius
method.description: Sets a specified particle radius value for self particle collisions. If set to 0, particles will collide with their radius. Default value is 0. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_shape_matching_enabled
method.description: Sets whether the shape matcing option is enabled for the body. If set to true, during the simulation process, all particles are forced to stay true to their undeformed positions. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_shape_matching_fixed_position
method.description: Sets the position of the target shape during shape matching if the fixed transform feature is active. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_shape_matching_fixed_rotation
method.description: Sets the rotation value of the target shape during shape matching if the fixed transform feature is active. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_shape_matching_fixed_transform_enabled
method.description: Sets whether you will be able to determine the position and rotation of the target shape when the shape matching feature is active. If set to true, you will be able to adjust the position and rotation values of the target shape yourself. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_shape_matching_rate
method.description: Sets the rate value to apply the shape matching to the body. [param value]: A value to set.

method.name: set_target_preservation_area
method.description: Sets the total target area to apply area preserving if the area preserving is enabled. [param value]: A value to set.

members.member: Sets whether the area preserving option is enabled of the body. If the area preserving option is enabled, the total area of the polygon are calculated at each physics step, and forces are applied to the particles that define the boundaries of the polygon to achieve a total area that can be determined by the user. If the user does not specify, when this option is enabled, the target area is calculated based on the original positions of the polygon particles, in other words, the total area of undeformed polygons are set as the target area.
Sets the rate to apply area preserving to the body if the area preserving is enabled. Determines the rate of the target area to apply preserve constraints.

Sets the rigidity to apply area preserving to the body if the area preserving is enabled. Determines the hardness of the restrictions to be applied to particles for the application of the target area.

Sets whether the particle-spesific mass option is enabled for the body. If this option is set to true, particles will continue to move with the mass defined for the body, but a specific mass value provided by you will be used for collision and constraint calculations. In most case, you don't want the mass value defined for the entire soft body object to be used for individual particle collision and constraint responses. Instead, you can define a specific particle mass value by dividing the mass value of the body by the number of particles, for example.
Sets the particle-specific mass value of the body. This value is used if the particle-specific mass option is enabled.

Sets whether to passivate the internal spring connections of the soft body. If this option is enabled, the internal springs are more passive in the simulation, which can be useful for soft bodies where the internal springs and particle connections only provide UV and other data based on the movement of the soft body.
Sets the rigidity of the body. It determines the rigidity of the spring joints of the body.
Sets whether self particle collisions are enabled for the body. If set to true, all mesh parts within the body will collide with each other.
Sets a specified particle radius value for self particle collisions. If set to 0, particles will collide with their radius. Default value is 0.
Sets whether the shape matcing option is enabled for the body. If set to true, during the simulation process, all particles are forced to stay true to their undeformed positions.

Sets whether you will be able to determine the position and rotation of the target shape when the shape matching feature is active. If set to true, you will be able to adjust the position and rotation values of the target shape yourself.
Sets the rate value to apply the shape matching to the body.
